required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Population-based Study of Macular Choroidal Neovascularization in a Chinese Population
clinical_study.official_title: A Population-based Study of Macular Choroidal Neovascularization Using Optical Coherence Tomography in a Chinese Population

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate pathomorphological and functional variations of choroidal neovascularization (CNV) in age-related macular degeneration (AMD) in a Chinese population using optical coherence tomography (OCT) to find which kinds of Fundus characteristics indicated exudative AMD.

detailed_description.textblock: This population-based study enrolled 59 patients (>45 years old; 70 eyes) with early and intermediate-stage AMD from Youyi Street, Baoshan District, Shanghai, China. Comprehensive standardized ophthalmic examinations included visual acuity, anterior segment analysis by slit lamp, dilated fundus evaluation by direct ophthalmoscopy, 90D handheld lens, fundus photography, fluorescein angiography (FFA), and fast optic disk scans using OCT. The macular CNV characteristic profiles in early and intermediate-stage AMD were determined by OCT. Data were obtained at first visit and 6 to 24 months follow-up, and FFA and OCT outcomes of early and intermediate-stage AMD patients were analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: change of the early and intermediate-stage AMD
primary_outcome.description: Drusen with unclear boundaries and obvious pigment proliferation, with hypofluorescence around drusens seen on FFA and a slight small arch field located in the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE)/choriocapillary layer (CCL) on OCT indicated exudative AMD.

arm_group.description: Follow-up observation was implemented in whose fundus examination show lesions in the early and intermediate-stage AMD

intervention.description: a epidemiologic survey of ocular diseases in an adult population (>45 years old) in Youyi Street, Baoshan District, Shanghai, China, conducted to determine the prevalence of AMD in the region. To this end, we utilized routine ocular examinations

study_pop.textblock: recruited 1813 adults citizens aged above 45 years by probability sampling from the Youyi Street, Baoshan District, Shanghai, China for an epidemiologic survey. All participants gave written informed consent, and this study was approved by the local Ethics Committee in accordance with the Helsinki Declaration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults citizens aged above 45 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- lost samples

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of ophthalmology, Shuguang hospital(Baoshan branch),Shanghai University of TCM
